instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>- Won't Start off the battery.... Stumped
threads.message:
Customer came in with a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. She said it froze and shut off and wouldnt come back on. Customer brought it to apple, diagnosed as bad battery. They replaced the battery and the problem remains. They sent it to me... No signs of liquid damage, Works fine off the charger... If i plug the battery in <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is at 8.49 v. PPV3.42 is present. There is no fan spin. However, if i Plug the charger in it starts. If i remove the charger, it runs fine as long as you start it  with the charger. 

Here is where things get interesting.... I was measuring voltage at the SMC When I accidentally touched the meter lead between <RESISTOR>R5170</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5172</RESISTOR>... The fan started to spin and the board started... So that must mean the SMC is not on when the battery is plugged in. It passes ASD on battery and when plugged in. The customer is really nice and would like to get this board fixed. Thank you to any help you can provide me. I ordered a TPS51980A (<CHIP>U7501</CHIP>) Becuase that is my guess to what the probelm is.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>- Won't Start off the battery.... Stumped
threads.message: Battery recognized is OSX with correct readings of cycles and voltages?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>- Won't Start off the battery.... Stumped
threads.message: Yes. Battery is reconized and charging. 210 cycles and voltage is 8546.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>- Won't Start off the battery.... Stumped
threads.message: Does the board power up when you short the power on pads? <RESISTOR>R5115</RESISTOR>/16?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>- Won't Start off the battery.... Stumped
threads.message: Yes. The board does power on when I short those pads.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>- Won't Start off the battery.... Stumped
threads.message: Then your problem is in the keyboard/trackpad/flatcable.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>- Won't Start off the battery.... Stumped
threads.message: It won't Start even if all of that is unplugged. I have the board on my bench and when I plug the battery in the board does nothing... No fan spin unless i short the pins... If i plug the charger in it starts fine,

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>- Won't Start off the battery.... Stumped
threads.message: That is normal. When AC is connected after all power was removed the board auto powers on. When on battery or after a shutdown you need to press the power button.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>- Won't Start off the battery.... Stumped
threads.message: After more diagnosing, the board operates normally with they keyboard flex cable unplugged, however, when the keyboard is plugged in, the board won't even start if I jumper <RESISTOR>R5115</RESISTOR>. So what would cause it not to start with the keyboard plugged in?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>- Won't Start off the battery.... Stumped
threads.message:
A bad keyboard....

You can test with any apple unibody keyboard to see if power button works, they all have the same pinout.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>- Won't Start off the battery.... Stumped
threads.message: Just took out the ribbon cable, BURNED.... Could it be just the cable??

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>- Won't Start off the battery.... Stumped
threads.message: All of the pins on the tracpad board look excellent.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>- Won't Start off the battery.... Stumped
threads.message: I cleaned the cable, It starts now with it plugged it, but immediately you can smell burning board from the trackpad area.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>- Won't Start off the battery.... Stumped
threads.message: I assumed you check the trackpad to board cable. The cable is fucked if it is corroded. If it has been burning the connector is also probably fucked now. Clean everything up and try with a NEW cable.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>- Won't Start off the battery.... Stumped
threads.message: Ok.. I will order a new cable.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>- Won't Start off the battery.... Stumped
threads.message: Thanks for your help Duke. The new cable still burned and after looking at the trackpad logic board under the microscope it is fucked up bad. Sold customer new keyboard and trackpad.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>- Won't Start off the battery.... Stumped
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>- Won't Start off the battery.... Stumped
threads.message: Ordered a new Top cover assem. Should be here tomarrow. Will let you know.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>- Won't Start off the battery.... Stumped
threads.message: Everything is fixed and working as expected....
